alert.note: Alert for Grant (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 15 at 2:09PM CST until February 16 at 6:00PM CST by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Accumulating Snow for Thursday... .Snow is expected to develop early Thursday morning across far southwest Wisconsin into northeast Iowa, diminishing later in the afternoon. A sharp gradient is expected in snow with amounts decreasing to the north. A narrow band of snow amounts exceeding 6 inches could not be ruled out, especially across southern Grant County. Snowfall may vary considerably over short distances and even small north or south adjustments in track will impact amounts. Continue to monitor forecasts if you have travel planned across southern Wisconsin into parts of northeast Iowa on Thursday. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 3 AM TO 6 PM CST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 6 inches. The higher amounts are most likely across southern portions of the counties. * WHERE...In Iowa, Clayton County. In Wisconsin, Grant County. * WHEN...From 3 AM to 6 PM CST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing snow could reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. In Iowa, visit 511ia.org for road conditions. In Wisconsin, visit 511wi.gov for road conditions.
